7cf65ae5-9aab-4566-a7bb-e73e6dadfb21.description: Through practical activities and an on-site visit to Holmesglen Institute, earners have experienced insights into health industry pathways. Earners have participated in activities related to an injured patient’s journey through healthcare. Focusing on interactive activities, students have explored the role of nurses, lab skills, pathology, and simulations in patient care training. Earners have attended an immersion day at Holmesglen Institute, delivered in collaboration with Monash Tech School.
7cf65ae5-9aab-4566-a7bb-e73e6dadfb21.name: Health Industries - Immersion Day

badge_template_activities.title: Nurse's roles in patient care - Earners have participated in and completed activities surrounding medical procedures used by nurses every day, including observing patient vital signs, neurological assessments, oxygen therapy, urine testing, and altering IV fluids and drip factors.

Pathology/Lab Skills - Earners have engaged in pathology and laboratory techniques such as preparing and observing live eukaryotic human cheek cells, wet mount microscopic technique, pathology request simulations, and blood spinning.

Simulations in patient care training - Earners have learnt about the importance of simulations in training health care professionals and investigated processes involved in saving a life through an introduction to basic life support and CPR.

Insights into health industry pathways - Earners have participated in a careers and pathways session delivered by Holmesglen Institute’s Faculty of Health Science, Youth and Community Studies. Earners have been able to interview Holmesglen Institute students about their career and study experiences.

c0bf69b5-0e26-4b00-8e8d-c9aa6859c0ee.description: Earners of this badge are able to understand the basic technical, ethical, and social influences that underpin the development of a voicebot. They can work collaboratively with a team to design, create and visualise a voicebot via Fabella Software. Earners can apply action-based research to their designs to present to and apply industry feedback.
c0bf69b5-0e26-4b00-8e8d-c9aa6859c0ee.name: Superbots - Two Day Immersion

badge_template_activities.title: This Monash Tech School initiative is co-designed with Professor of Digital Technology and Society, Yolande Strengers from Monash Faculty of Information Technology – an award-winning specialist in Al and smart devices.
Yolande Strengers - Monash University
Students have participated in an interactive design-sprint session that explores the history and ethics of voicebots and the societal influences on voice assistant software development.

Students have participated in a Fabella Tech Tutorial and learned the basics of building a voicebot prototype. Students have simulated user testing by embodying their voicebot personalities in a 'Wizard of Oz' format.

Students have shared their designs with, and applied feedback from industry experts including those from the Women in Voice Australia & New Zealand Chapter, Monash University Faculty of IT Academics, and PhD Candidates.
Students have explored design aspects including colour, shape, rotation, speed, and size.
Using basic scaffolding principles and processes, students have mapped their voicebot's emotion states.
Using a P5JS web application, students have implemented their emotion state map to visualise their voicebot.
Students have worked in small groups to present their prototypes to peers, academics and industry professionals.

Using zoom, students have incorporated online communication skills, such as tone of voice, facial expression and body language, to present their prototypes and receive feedback from industry professionals. With their cameras and microphones on, students could articulate ideas and interact professionally.
Kathryn Sadler - Women in Voice
Nicola MacLay - Women in Voice
Jeanna Manifold - Women in Voice
Kirrily Denny - Women in Voice

058bd16e-732a-448c-93d5-d0b9b582799c.description: Through interacting with expert educators in the fields of Data Analytics, Media and Communications, and through investigating technologies used in AFLW player performance, earners have experienced insights into Sports Technologies, AFLW, and Communications pathways. Earners have participated in an AFLW fitness session and learnt about the skills needed to produce media content for a professional sporting organisation.
058bd16e-732a-448c-93d5-d0b9b582799c.name: Supersport - Immersion Day

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have investigated technologies used to track player performance in sports, including AFLW, by using Catapult tracking pods. Earners have participated in a football fitness activity using the technologies and looked into the resulting data post activity.

Earners have interacted with expert educators and professionals in the fields of Data Analytics, Media and Communications. Earners have been able to ask questions of the professionals to assist them to understand the links between sports analytics and public-facing media.

Earners have participated in a collaborative media-focused activity where they have discovered how to produce different kinds of media content for a wide range of audiences related to professional sporting clubs. Earners have presented their work to their peers through communicating the reasoning behind their content choices.

350b110a-92fe-49f0-b688-0a1746583dc4.description: Earners of this badge can work to an exceptional standard of quality in designing and prototyping solutions to make cities more sustainable. In addition, they have demonstrated a high ability to communicate their solution to a panel of industry experts.
350b110a-92fe-49f0-b688-0a1746583dc4.name: Pitch 2 Panel (2021)

alignments.name: Sustainable Cities Case Study-2020
alignments.description: Earned through achieving an exceptional standard of quality through the Sustainable Cities program. During this endevor, students have received a description of a city in decline and have developed a plan to revitalise the city including: Economic, Societal and Enviromental factors.

badge_template_activities.title: To qualify for this badge, teams must have been selected for the top 10 out of their cohort in the Sustainable Cities program. They have worked in teams to create comprehensive and outstanding designs and demonstrated excellent storytelling and communication skills. These top 10 groups have been invited to present their projects at the Pitch 2 Panel competition to a panel of experts from government, academia, and industry sectors.

During the competition, the top 10 teams will put their pitching skills to the test as they communicate their designs to a panel of experts. They have spent the term working on a sustainable path forward for their allocated underperforming cities. They will have 10 minutes to present their work in a live presentation. The panel will assess not only their designs, but methodology, and presentation skills as well.
Panellist 1: Karen Freidin - CEO Reluv
Panellist 2: Daniel Berry - City of Monash Sustainability Officer
Panellist 3: Liton Kamruzzaman - MADA Associate Professor Urban PLanning & Design
Panellist 4: Vito Chiodo - National Property Director Schiavello Group
Video Recap

fbad04ee-f6b1-4657-a1a9-2165d1a1ce7f.description: Through engaging in active career conversations with secondary school students, earners have participated in multiple short interviews where they shared their own career tips, advice and experiences. Earners supported students to gain insight into their industry have shared their expertise that has allowed students to unpack multiple career pathways and occupations. Earners have supported excellence in STEAM as part of the Victorian Government's Tech Schools Initiative.
fbad04ee-f6b1-4657-a1a9-2165d1a1ce7f.name: Career Launchpad - Industry Expert

badge_template_activities.title: Short interviews - Earners have participated in multiple short interviews with a variety of students, where they answered individual questions from each student. Through their responses, they have shared their experience and expertise with secondary school students.
Unpacked career pathways - Earners have assisted students to unpack different career pathways through engaging in active, personalised conversations with a variety of students.

Career Launchpad - An initiative by Monash Tech School hosted at the Monash University Woodside Building for Technology and Design. It was opened by Victoria's Lead Scientist. 44 industry professionals from a diverse range of industries who are contributing to positive social change were invited to speed network with 86 students.

36d401bf-7f11-472c-ae66-a098739bca53.description: Through an on-site visit of the Yakult Australia's advanced manufacturing facility, earners have a foundational level understanding of lab skills used at Yakult to ensure quality health food products. Earners can work in teams to complete science communication/public health challenges. Earners have attended an immersion day at Yakult, delivered in collaboration with Monash Tech School.
36d401bf-7f11-472c-ae66-a098739bca53.name: Smart Food - Immersion Day

badge_template_activities.title: Lab Skills - Earners learn and perform laboratory protocols that are used in the lab to support activities at Yakult and similar Biotechnology companies. This includes basic analytical tests such as water quality testing, counting/visualizing bacteria, using Brix test to measure sucrose level, and more.

Science Communication - Earners choose to address a public health issue either through public messaging, product development, or both. After selecting a public health issue of interest, students have formed groups, researched the public health topic of interest, and developed unique public messaging to help raise awareness towards the issue. Each group have displayed and presented their topic of interest and messages on a poster communicated to the rest of the class.

skills.name: Ability To Work In A Team

c2e57bf9-c3b7-49d2-9915-65f794e0a00a.description: Earners of this badge are able to understand the basic technical, ethical, and social influences that underpin the development of a voice bot. They can work collaboratively with a team to design and create a voice bot via Talk Via One Software. Earners can apply action-based research to their designs to present to and apply industry feedback.
c2e57bf9-c3b7-49d2-9915-65f794e0a00a.name: Superbots - Immersion Day (2021-2022)

badge_template_activities.title: This Monash Tech School initiative is co-designed with Associate Professor Yolande Strengers from Monash Faculty of Information Technology – an award-winning specialist in Al and smart devices.
Yolande Strengers - Monash University
Students have participated in an interactive design-sprint session that explores the history, ethics, and societal influences on voice bots and voice-assisted software development.
Students have participated in a Talk Via One, Tech Tutorial and learned the basics of building a voice-bot prototype.
Students have shared their designs with industry experts from Women in Voice Australia & New Zealand Chapter.
Kathryn Sadler - Women in Voice
Nicola MacLay - Women in Voice
Jenna Manifold - Women in Voice

cc405535-f129-4a98-846c-92b53a57964f.description: Through an in-person workshop hosted by the Monash Tech School, earners have completed an introduction to Fusion 360 modelling software. Earners of this badge have been exposed to the wonders of 3D Solid Modelling, becoming comfortable with navigating the Fusion 360, understanding typical workflows and key considerations for successful modelling.
cc405535-f129-4a98-846c-92b53a57964f.name: Fusion 360

badge_template_activities.title: Earners are familiar with creating well-defined sketches, pushing the limits of the extrude tool, and augmenting the results through mirroring and circular patterns.
Earners possess an understanding of the benefits of solid modelling and have experience with typical modelling workflows.

f3db3455-b1a8-4a39-ae2e-897e8bbefdce.description: Through an onsite visit to the Australian International Airshow and a unique tour experience focusing on the Australian Space Industry, earners have gained insights into aerospace, space, and defence industries' technology pathways. Earners have participated in a Q&A session with Space Command, explored the Corporate Exposition, and viewed the aerial flying display. Earners have attended an immersion day at the Australian International Airshow, delivered in collaboration with Monash Tech School.
f3db3455-b1a8-4a39-ae2e-897e8bbefdce.name: Australian International Airshow Student Delegation - Immersion Day

badge_template_activities.title: Participated in a Q&A session - Earners have engaged in a Q&A session with industry professionals from Space Command and RAAF. Earners have practised active listening skills and asked thoughtful questions. As a result, students have gained direct insight into the industries and career pathways surrounding Space Command and RAAF.

Explored the Corporate Exposition - Earners have visited designated exhibitor stands, including the STEM pavilion, Defence Space Command, Australian Space Agency, BAE, Boeing, BOM, the Victorian Government, and Lockheed Martin. Earners have been able to use initiative to independently explore the stands, ask questions of the exhibitors and gain insights into an industry-based exposition environment.

Viewed the aerial flying display - Earners have experienced the aerial flying display at the Australian International Airshow. Earners have directly seen the tangible outcomes of the aerospace industry by watching the display. Earners were able to discover how the various industry insights they had gained earlier in the day could contribute to a deeper understanding of pathways in aerospace, defence, and space industries.

e7ea3b27-8b6c-4828-95c5-28ecc5b40376.description: Earners of this badge can work to an exceptional standard of quality in designing and prototyping solutions to make cities more sustainable. In addition, they have demonstrated a high ability to communicate their solution to a panel of industry experts.
e7ea3b27-8b6c-4828-95c5-28ecc5b40376.name: Pitch 2 Panel (2022)

alignments.name: Sustainable Cities Case Study-2020
alignments.description: Earned through achieving an exceptional standard of quality through the Sustainable Cities program. During this endevor, students have received a description of a city in decline and have developed a plan to revitalise the city including: Economic, Societal and Enviromental factors.

badge_template_activities.title: To qualify for this badge, teams must have been selected for the top 8 out of their cohort in the Sustainable Cities program. They have worked in teams to create comprehensive and outstanding designs and demonstrated excellent storytelling and communication skills. These top 8 groups have been invited to present their projects at the Pitch 2 Panel competition to a panel of experts from government, academia, and industry sectors.

During the competition, the top 8 teams will put their pitching skills to the test as they communicate their designs to a panel of experts. They have spent the term working on a sustainable path forward for their allocated underperforming cities. They will have 10 minutes to present their work in a live presentation. The panel will assess not only their designs, but methodology, and presentation skills as well.
Panellist 1: Karen Freidin - CEO Reluv
Panellist 2: Susie Petris - Sustainability Officer at City of Monash
Panellist 3: Associate Professor Megan Farrelly - Interim Head, School of Social Sciences at Monash University
Panellist 4: Vito Chiodo - National Property Director Schiavello Group
Video Recap

8c54920a-60a8-429e-8a01-66a0d3e01fa1.description: Earners have drawn on their industry experience in the fields of health industries to support secondary school students in an Industry Immersion Day. Earners have provided career and study advice to students and presented their own experiences at Holmesglen Institute. Earners have supported student activities and utilised their own expertise in various areas of health industries to provide guidance to participating students.
8c54920a-60a8-429e-8a01-66a0d3e01fa1.name: Health Industries - Industry Participant

badge_template_activities.title: Industry Participant - Earners have been selected to be Holmesglen Institute representatives and have shared their industry knowledge and experiences with secondary school students throughout the day.

Background knowledge and experience - Earners have utilised their own industry experience and applied their knowledge to student work. Earners have considered how to relate their own working knowledge to secondary school students learnings.

f1857b98-3ef0-44fd-97a0-f49bc75908d2.description: Earners have drawn on their industry experience in the fields of urban planning, innovation, and sustainability to evaluate student submissions from the Pitch 2 Panel competition. Earners have been a part of a panel of industry experts who have assessed student pitches from Sustainable Cities projects. Earners provided kind, specific and helpful feedback to secondary school students.
f1857b98-3ef0-44fd-97a0-f49bc75908d2.name: Pitch 2 Panel - Industry Expert

badge_template_activities.title: Industry Participant - Earners have been selected to be a part of the industry panel and have shared their industry knowledge and experiences with students as a part of the evaluation process.

Background knowledge and experience - Earners have utilised their own industry experience and applied their knowledge to student work. Earners have considered how to relate their own working knowledge to student projects.

Student-focused evaluation - Earners have applied their own experience to participate in a student-focused evaluation. Earners have adapted their advice and expertise to provide constructive feedback to student participants.

69f38af4-b53a-452c-87fc-43f2b40395c5.description: Earners of this badge are able to understand the basic technical, ethical, and social influences that underpin the development of a voicebot. They can work collaboratively with a team to design and create a voicebot via Fabella Software. Earners can apply action-based research to their designs to present to and apply industry feedback.
69f38af4-b53a-452c-87fc-43f2b40395c5.name: Superbots - One Day Immersion

badge_template_activities.title: This Monash Tech School initiative is co-designed with Professor of Digital Technology and Society, Yolande Strengers from Monash Faculty of Information Technology – an award-winning specialist in Al and smart devices.
Yolande Strengers - Monash University
Students have participated in an interactive design-sprint session that explores the history and ethics of voicebots and the societal influences on voice assistant software development.

Students have participated in a Fabella Tech Tutorial and learned the basics of building a voicebot prototype. Students have simulated user testing by embodying their voicebot personalities in a 'Wizard of Oz' format.

Students have shared their designs with and applied feedback from industry experts including those from Women in Voice Australia & New Zealand Chapter, Monash University Faculty of IT Academics, and PhD Candidates.

Using zoom, students have incorporated online communication skills, such as tone of voice, facial expression and body language, to present their prototypes and receive feedback from industry professionals. With their cameras and microphones on, students could articulate ideas and interact professionally.
Kathryn Sadler - Women in Voice
Nicola MacLay - Women in Voice
Jeanna Manifold - Women in Voice
Kirrily Denny - Women in Voice

d412f076-43f9-428d-ad5f-f355c0a31c60.description: Through a Metro Tunnel Education Program workshop, earners have gained an understanding of Victoria's rail infrastructure projects and participated in a unique innovation experience. Earners with support utilised technologies such as Augmented Reality, Ozobots and Virtual Reality to investigate how STEM is used in real-world logistics, engineering and construction. Earners have attended an immersion day at the Metro Tunnel HQ visitor centre, delivered in collaboration with Monash Tech School.
d412f076-43f9-428d-ad5f-f355c0a31c60.name: Rail Projects - Special Education Immersion Day

badge_template_activities.title: Using Technologies at Metro Tunnel HQ - Earners have participated in activities using technologies including Augmented Reality, Virtual Reality and Ozobots. Through Virtual Reality, earners have investigated the use of Tunnel Boring Machines in the engineering and construction industries. Earners have also used Ozobots in a collaborative activity where they have gained foundational knowledge around block coding techniques.

Unique Innovation Experience - Earners have participated in a tour of Metro Tunnel HQ. With guidance from the Metro Tunnel Education Program team, earners have gained knowledge of Victoria's rail infrastructure projects. Specifically, they have looked at how technologies such as Tunnel Boring Machines are used to efficiently build new train tunnels and how acoustic sheds are used to ensure liveability for residents whilst expanding Victoria's transport networks.
